title: Bootstrap Modals
subject: Bootstrap
theory:
## Pop-up Dialogs
Modals are dialog overlays that block interaction with the rest of the page.

### Structure
1. `.modal`: Main wrapper (hidden by default).
2. `.modal-dialog`: The width/margin container.
3. `.modal-content`: The actual white box.
4. `.modal-header`, `.modal-body`, `.modal-footer`.

### Triggering
Button with `data-bs-toggle="modal"` and `data-bs-target="#id"`.

examples.code:
<!-- Button trigger -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary" data-bs-toggle="modal" data-bs-target="#exampleModal">
  Launch demo modal
</button>

common_mistakes.correction: Always place modal HTML at the top level (just inside <body>) to avoid CSS z-index and position issues.
common_mistakes.example: Inside a relative div -> Modal gets clipped.

interview_questions.question: How to make a modal not close when clicking outside?

real_world_use_cases.description: User clicks delete -> Modal asks 'Are you sure?'.

summary: Modals focus user attention completely on a specific task or information.
